feed.title: Proposal: Force to do nothing for first 9 minutes to save 90% of mining energy

entry.title: Proposal: Force to do nothing for first 9 minutes to save 90% of mining energy
entry.summary: Eric Voskuil shared two links on the bitcoin-dev forum regarding the efficiency paradox and the proof-of-memory fallacy. According to Voskuil, the proposal would reduce chain security by 10%. While this proposal may seem to violate the efficiency paradox, it simply reduces the real cost of confirming a transaction by reducing security. This reduction in security leads to lower Bitcoin prices and less electricity being purchased with block rewards.
